JobTitle: Senior Model Based Systems Staff Engineer (Grand Prairie, TX)
JobFullDesc: Description:Lockheed Martin’s Missiles and Fire Control is standing up a team to accelerate the modernization our systems engineering processes, practices, and tools to support wide-spread adoption of model-based systems engineering (MBSE) and cross-functional integration. Members of this team will be resources to programs to enable efficient and effective implementation of MBSE. Specific responsibilities of these roles include:• Deploying to programs on short-term assignments to initiate & guide model-based systems engineering implementation.• Tracking product development efforts within their assigned LOB to ensure program needs are incorporated into the Systems Engineering Modernization roadmap.• Developing reference architectures for our key product lines for use as basis of program architectures.• Exploring and implementing advanced modeling features to integrate data across functional lines.• Developing & curating training material for MBSE.• Providing training, lunch and learns, and one-on-one coaching regarding MBSE implementation.Please see the You Tube videos below as examples of work completed by the engineers in the group.MFC in Action  LRASMBasic Qualifications:Experience with the following:• Open system architecture designs and partitioning.• System functionality definition including system states and modes or functional partitioning.• Generation of system models and development of requirements from the models.• MBSE tool sets; may include Cameo, MagicDraw and/or Rhapsody. • Generating ICDs and verifying compliance of supplier designs and capabilities.Desired Skills:• Broad understanding of the MFC Systems Engineering process including requirements management, functional/physical allocation, interface development, performance simulation, and verification.Experience with the following: • Execution within agile frameworks.• Presenting to internal and external stakeholders.• Ensuring the linkage between model-based system requirements and characteristics with detailed design data.• Establishing bi-directional connections between MBSE artifacts and design data in tools like Zuken, Cadence, Creo and Catia via WindChill digital PLM repositories.• Experience with modeling frameworks such as DoDAF and UAF.BASIC QUALIFICATIONS:job.QualificationsLockheed Martin is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer.
